About.

My name is Denis Moulin, I'm a human.

I don't believe that design can solve everything, I believe design must make our lives easier but not savorless. Let's take some risks.


Let's Talk, Meet, Work together!


Twitter Dribbble Readings

Résumé

After earning a degree in graphic design from Ecole Multimedia in Paris,

I joined Fred & Farid Paris(300 employees) in 2010.

I had fun growing there as a designer for two years, shaping brand image and generating interactive user experiences for brands including Martini, Orangina, and Société Générale.

Btw here is most of my previous work, mostly advestising/School work.



In late 2012 I joined Fontyou(15 employees), a Parisian start-up developing online collaborative typography tools.

I wanted to try a different work environment, learn new tools, try to help in a different way.

My work there on several fantastic projects around typography and type design community increased my sensitivity to user needs and expectations and broadened my perspective on design. I loved being part of a small team in a fast-paced work environment, and quickly adapted to the Agile methodology that we used.

My commitment to the project and the tight-knit atmosphere of our team led me to step into the role of product owner for both the platform and new tools, and I appreciated the responsibility and opportunities for growth that this role provided. I also had the opportunity to participate in recruitment, and learned a lot from fielding and developing talent.

Tools.

Don't sweat
the technique.

The pain and pleasure were mostly mine in building this site, but it wouldn't be live without the precious help and advice of Elisabeth and Cédric.

I used my favorite foundry Fontyou LeanO Sans and H&Co Sentinel Black.

This site runs with the great help of Retina.js , Daniel Eden Animate.css , Gridism.

I felt that I had more to give to some of my recent work and decided to take the time to finish as best I could. For this reason, some of the work that appears here might differ from what's online now.
